items.label: thm-invariant-measure-existence
items.title: Existence and Uniqueness of Invariant Measure
items.content:
392: :label: thm-invariant-measure-existence
393: 
394: For any choice of parameters $(\epsilon_{\text{rep}}, \delta, \kappa, r_0, \beta_{\text{gauge}}, T, N, R_{\text{cut}})$ satisfying:
395: - $\epsilon_{\text{rep}}, \delta, \kappa, r_0, \beta_{\text{gauge}}, T > 0$
396: - $N \geq 5$ (minimum for 4-dimensional Delaunay triangulation)
397: - $R_{\text{cut}} \geq 2r_0$ (ensures connectivity)
398: 
399: the MDLGT dynamics defined by {prf:ref}`def-mdlgt-dynamics` possess a unique invariant probability measure $\mu_{\text{inv}}$ on the constrained state space $\Sigma_N$.
400: 
401: Furthermore, the process converges to $\mu_{\text{inv}}$ exponentially fast in the total variation distance:
402: 
403: $$
404: \|\mathcal{L}^t(P_0) - \mu_{\text{inv}}\|_{\text{TV}} \leq C e^{-\lambda t}
405: 
406: $$

items.label: thm-finite-n-mass-gap
items.title: Mass Gap at Finite N
items.content:
412: :label: thm-finite-n-mass-gap
413: 
414: There exists a critical coupling $\beta_c(N) > 0$ such that for all $\beta_{\text{gauge}} < \beta_c(N)$ (strong-coupling regime) and for all choices of parameters satisfying the conditions of {prf:ref}`thm-invariant-measure-existence`, the equilibrium state $\mu_{\text{inv}}$ describes a confining theory with a mass gap:
415: 
416: $$
417: \Delta_N := \inf\{\omega > 0 : \omega \in \text{Spec}(\mathcal{H}_N) \setminus \{0\}\} > 0
418: 
419: $$
420: 
421: where $\mathcal{H}_N$ is the quantum Hamiltonian associated with the Euclidean field theory defined by $\mu_{\text{inv}}$, and $\text{Spec}(\mathcal{H}_N)$ is its spectrum.
422: 
423: Moreover, there exists a constant $\delta > 0$ independent of $N$ (but depending on $\beta_{\text{gauge}}$) such that:
424: 
425: $$
426: \Delta_N \geq \delta
427: 
428: $$

items.label: thm-continuum-limit
items.title: Existence of Continuum Limit
items.content:
434: :label: thm-continuum-limit
435: 
436: Consider a sequence of MDLGT systems indexed by $N$ with parameters chosen such that the average lattice spacing scales as:
437: 
438: $$
439: a_N \sim N^{-1/4}
440: 
441: $$
442: 
443: and the bare coupling runs according to:
444: 
445: $$
446: \beta_{\text{gauge}}(a_N) = \beta_{\text{gauge}}^{(0)} + b_0 \ln(a_N^{-1}) + O(1/\ln(a_N^{-1}))
447: 
448: $$
449: 
450: where $b_0 = \frac{11N_{\text{color}}}{3(4\pi)^2}$ is the one-loop beta function coefficient. Then:
451: 
452: 1. **Non-Triviality**: The limiting Schwinger functions (correlation functions of Wilson loops) exist and are non-trivial
453: 2. **Mass Gap Persistence**: The mass gap survives the continuum limit:
454: 
455: $$
456: \Delta := \lim_{N \to \infty} \Delta_N > 0
457: 
458: $$

items.label: thm-os-axioms
items.title: Osterwalder-Schrader Axioms
items.content:
464: :label: thm-os-axioms
465: 
466: The continuum limit theory constructed in {prf:ref}`thm-continuum-limit` satisfies all Osterwalder-Schrader axioms:
467: 
468: 1. **OS1 (Euclidean Invariance)**: The Schwinger functions are invariant under the Euclidean group $E(4)$
469: 2. **OS2 (Reflection Positivity)**: The Schwinger functions satisfy reflection positivity with respect to time reflection
470: 3. **OS3 (Cluster Property)**: Correlation functions decay exponentially at large separations (consequence of mass gap)
471: 4. **OS4 (Regularity)**: The Schwinger functions have appropriate analyticity and growth properties

items.label: thm-os-reconstruction
items.title: OS Reconstruction
items.content:
1254: :label: thm-os-reconstruction
1255: 
1256: There exists a unique relativistic quantum field theory in Minkowski spacetime, defined by:
1257: - A Hilbert space $\mathcal{H}$
1258: - A vacuum state $|0\rangle \in \mathcal{H}$
1259: - A strongly continuous unitary representation $U(g)$ of the Poincare group
1260: - Gauge field operators $A_{\mu}(x)$ (or Wilson loop operators) satisfying the Wightman axioms
items.raw_directive:
